fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45615].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a group was no longer active but it's still added in any of the Permission like _Browse Project Permission_. The creation of project will still be successful but user will not be able to view the project created. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a warning if a group was no longer active but it's still added in Browse Project Permission when a Project is created
fields.summary: Provide a warning if a group was no longer active but it's still added in Browse Project Permission when a Project is created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45614].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Stability and up-time are important aspects on a product for Enterprise customers. Often we see one of the feature from an add-on consume large amount of resources causing JIRA to crash and become unavailable.

h3. Suggested Solution
Having an option to set per-plugin (per-addon) resource limit (and monitoring) to avoid the entire instance to become unavailable due to insufficient resources.

h3. Workaround 
On related cases, the process includes
# Reviewing support zip and thread dumps
# Analyze heap dump
# Identify the problem
# Disable/troubleshoot the add-on
fields.summary: Allow to Set Maximum Allocated Resource for Add-ons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45613].
  {panel}

h6. Problem Definition
As of now, should there an incremental synchronisation of an External User Directory fails in JIRA, the JIRA Administrator will only be able to identify it by navigating to _User Directories_ page itself.

h6. Suggested Solution
To implement email notifications feature in JIRA should incremental synchronisation fails so the JIRA Administrator would be able to detect it as soon as when the problem occurs to minimise the impact to JIRA users.
fields.summary: To Implement Email Notifications should Incremental Synchronisation Fails
Change CAC page - remove or fix global permissions on project permissions page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45605].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Update as of 30 October 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,

The apparent random behaviour was due to the fact that successfully pasting an image depended on the image itself. If the image contained "http" within its base64 binary representation, JIRA would consider it a link and ignore it.
Of course the chances of "http" appearing somewhere in the pasted image would go up when the image size goes up, and so this explains why this rarely occurred with smaller images.

Thank you for reporting this. Please let us know if you encounter more issues.
Cheers,
Mina
{panel}

h3. Summary

New attach screenshot CTRL +V keyboard shortcut doesn't work reliably in Firefox browser.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Open an issue in Firefox browser
* Take a printscreen using keyboard key
* Press CTRL + V

h3. Expected Results

The dialogue to attach screenshot should appear in single press.

h3. Actual Results

* It requires multiple key press most of the time before user is prompted with the dialogue.
* There are occurrences where screenshot need to be taken or issue need to be refreshed before it starts working again.

h3. Workaround
Try with multiple CTRL + V presses or refresh the issue before trying it again.
fields.summary: New attach screenshot doesn't work reliably in Firefox browser

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45604].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
A user has a situation where they would like to select specific people from various ADs giving the select users from these users various permissions that allow them work on issues in JIRA(the users are expected to maintain their groups from their individual servers)

Due to the above scenario, setting up multiple directories would not be viable as JIRA would only read groups from the directory at the top of the order.

This would also allow the user filter groups from multiple directories.

*Expected Feature*
Allow user specify multiple Base DNs separating the different servers with a semicolon.

*Add-on*
Can this be extended to other products such as Confluence?
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Accept Multiple AD Base DNs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45601].
  {panel}

It seems that the sensitive information leakage is something almost impossible to avoid when you have a pair of JIRA instances, internal and external, which are connected one to another.

Having them connected is clearly a business requirement for being able to cross link issues and to copy them from internal to external. 

Even so it seems that internal activity information goes to the public instance freely when you connected them. 

So far Atlassian support recommended to disable the activity feed plugin, but this change is not persisitent between service restarts not between service upgrades.

We do not a configurable option that is persistent like we already have the parameters for disabling email in JAVA_OPTS.
fields.summary: Prevent Activity feed information leakage by allowing permanently disabling of it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45597].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In 'Create Issue' dialog, if there is no matched Component with user's input, 'Component/s' filed should show an appropriate error message.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA
# Make a project
# Make sure the current user has a project administrator permission (if the user doesn't, grant the permission to the user)
# Add a component to the project (any component name could be)
# Add a version to the project (any version name could be)
# Open 'Create Issue' dialog
# Input all mandatory fields
# Input a component name which doesn't exist in the project in 'Component/s' field and put ESC key
# Input a version name which doesn't exist in the project in 'Affects Version/s' field and put ESC key
# Input a version name which doesn't exist in the project in 'Fix Version/s' field and put ESC key
# Click 'Create' button

h3. Expected Results
'Component/s' field should show an error *"Component with id 'xxxxx' does not exist."* as 'Affects Version/s' and 'Fix Version/s' field show such error messages.

h3. Actual Results
'Component/s' field doesn't show any error. (Please see a following image.)
!with_project_admin_permission.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
If the current user doesn't have a project administrator permission, the appropriate error message is shown. (Please see a following image.)
!without_project_admin_permission.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'Component/s' filed should show an appropriate error message when creating an issue

Hello,

When you export the issues from JIRA's issue navigator, the default paper size is set in the Excel file as LETTER. There is the widespread international ISO standard (A4, B3, C4, etc.) and then there is the local standard only used in North America.

Please advise how we can change this setting either during the build or via user configuration.

Thanks,
Kerrin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45583].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

It is possible to install any 32 bit version of JIRA prior to JIRA 7 on Windows 7 64 bit, but installing 32 bit JIRA 7 on Windows 64 bit ends up with issues.

The root cause is, installer tries to run JIRA with incorrect version of tomcat binary

h3. Environment

Windows 7 64 bit 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
Install JIRA 7 32 bit on Windows 7 64 bit

h3. Expected Results
JIRA 7 32 bit should run and work perfectly

h3. Actual Results
The installation is successful, but navigating to JIRA instance URL does not return anything.
Also there won't be any JIRA Home directory. 
User is not able to run the JIRA Service. 

h3. Workaround
in file {{<install-dir>\bin\service.bat}} locate line:
{code}set "EXECUTABLE=%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\tomcat8.exe.x64"{code}
and replace it with (remove x64):
{code}set "EXECUTABLE=%CATALINA_HOME%\bin\tomcat8.exe"{code}
in file {{bin/check-java.bat}} remove quotes around {{%_EXECJAVA%}}
fields.summary: Unable To Install JIRA 7 32 bit on Windows 64 bit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45580].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When clicking from the comments tab to history or all in the activity section of a JIRA issue you will see a 'Communications Breakdown' error. The development tools in Chrome show a 404.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA Cloud 7.0.OD-7
* JIRA Server 6.4.X and JIRA 7.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ESS-64 without logging in.
# Click the 'History' tab

_*OR*_

# Install a fresh clean server instance
# Create a new project and issue
# Change the permission for the project to allow 'anyone' to browse project/administer project
# Log out
# Go to any of the issue from the new project
# Click on the history/activity tab

h3. Expected Results

Show the history/activity tab contents.

h3. Actual Results
*For JIRA 6.4.x*
The UI throws a 'Communications Breakdown' error with the text

{noformat}
The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.
Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser
{noformat}

Development tools show a 404 error.
 !activity1.png|thumbnail! 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
*For JIRA 7.x*
{noformat}
This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. 
If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard
{noformat}
 !activity.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes
Logging in solves the problem. So it's something specific

h3.Workaround
If you can log in you'll need to do that.
fields.summary: Activity tabs showing error when accessing issue through anonymous user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45579].
  {panel}

h3. Environment
Internet Explorer, versions 11 and 10.

h3. Expected behavior
Issue Status lozenges should have the width automatically set based on the size of its title.
h5. Example
The lozenge for the "Open" status should be smaller than the one for the "Resolved" status.

h3. Actual behavior
All Issue Status lozenges are set to the max width.
h5. Example
Contrary to the example above, the lozenge for the "Open" status is set to the same size as the one for the "Resolved" status.

h3. Testing Notes
* [This issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35237] is an example of this behavior (see screenshot);
* Feature seems to work fine in Firefox, Chrome and Safari;
fields.summary: Status lozenges have a full width display in IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45565].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Only admins can create issues into multiple JIRA projects using the CSV importer. Non-admin can only create multiple issue into a single JIRA project and don't have access to this page:

 !csv.jpg|thumbnail! 


h5. Suggestion
Allow non-admin users to create issues via CSV on multiple projects at once.
fields.summary: Allow non-admin users to create issues into multiple JIRA projects using the CSV importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45564].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently we have the pre-defined categories (see screenshot), they are limited in the sense that I can't see for examples, all bugs in the current release.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow custom filters to add to this panel as a category, which will allow for easier browsing of the release.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want to customize the release report tab header to include custom filters
Update the atlassian-whitelist plugin to a version >= 1.18 to fix https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AW-6
When some async operations fail they show a window.alert()
Update Migrating JIRA do Another Server document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45554].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Actually some JIRA functionalities are not available on mobile devices, like creating, editing and searching for issues.

h5. Suggestion
Allow all JIRA basic functionalities to work on mobile versions.
fields.summary: Allow more options on mobile devices.
Support Windows Phone 8.1+

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45552].
  {panel}

h3.Problem Definition
In the new Project Project Role management introduced in JIRA 7.0 it would be beneficial for Admins to be able to add multiple Roles to selected users.
- https://<BASE_URL>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/project-config/<PROJECT_ID>/roles


h3.Suggested Solution
Make Role Drop down box multi-select


h3.Workaround 
Current Role association involves:
- Search for and add user names or groups
- Select Single Role from drop-down
- Select add
- Repeat for all needed role associations
fields.summary: Ability to add multiple roles to user or groups
Blue cog icon broken in documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45550].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
The official Microsoft SQL Server drivers, provided by Microsoft, support multiple useful features, like Windows Authentication and Automatic failover, however are not compatible with JIRA.

h5. Suggestion
Add support for official Microsoft SQL drivers instead of JDBC.
fields.summary: Support for Microsoft SQL Server JDBC Driver
Add three point estimation

fields.summary: Datasource dbcp.numActive not found

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45547].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA allows project import from CSV, Bugzilla, Redmine... but not XML. It would make migration from own installation much easier.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the possibility to import project from XML.
 
h3. Workaround 
If possible, the XML file can be converted to JSON and then follow the instructions at [Importing data from JSON|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Importing+Data+from+JSON]. Also, data can be imported from CSV as per [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Importing+Data+from+CSV].
fields.summary: Add XML import to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45545].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

JIRA will enforce a dot or a comma on a Number Field (custom field) depending on the language specified. For example:

In English I would use 1.5 while in Russian you would use 1,5. 
This can become an issue when a customer wants to use 1.5 while using a Russian language pack in this example.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the number formatting a configurable option, regardless of the language the System or User has configured.
fields.summary: As an admin i would like to specify the number field (custom field) formatting as a configuration option, regardless of user language or system language preferences.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45543].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
For Cloud instances, users can log in using both username and email. However, when using API, it always confuses user as they attempt to place the email as the username.

h5. Suggestion
It would be great if we allow email address to be placed as username to access the REST APIs.
fields.summary: Allow Usage of REST API using email as Alternative

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45541].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When using the "External System Import" to update issues, the completion message doesn't display the amount of issues updated. It only displays Issues and Projects *created*.

*For example, it will display:*
"7 projects and 0 issues imported successfully!"
*When it should be displaying:*
"0 new issues created and 149 issues were updated across 7 projects."

*Reason:*
"External System Import" was designed as a migration tool 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the updated amount of issues to the message.

h3. Workaround 
Use the "Import Issues from CSV" option to update issues.
[JRA-39749 - "Import Issues from CSV" button doesn't work in the same way as "External System Import"|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-39749]
fields.summary: "External System Import" of CSV should display the amount of Issues Updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45514].
  {panel}

A field content (native or custom) can be modified via Bulk change (Edit Issues), even if the field is not part of the EDIT screen. This is not consistent with the behavior of the simple Edit operation. When a a field is not part of the EDIT screen - it cannot be modified when the Edit button is clicked - it cannot be modified via the inline edit, but anything can be done via bulk. If a field is not part of the EDIT screen then it's because it's not supposed to be updated via any EDIT operation.
Just to provide more detail: In certain Jira implementations, some fields are supposed to be modified only during particular transitions. These fields are not supposed to be edited via the edit operation. In order to accomplish this we add these fields in the VIEW screen (so anybody can see the content at any time), but we don't add the fields in the EDIT screen (so these fields cannot be update via the edit operation / inline edit). The fields are added only to screens that are displayed during the transitions when the fields are supposed to be modified.
Everything works great but the problem is that if you perform a Bulk change (Edit Issues), everything can be modified, even the fields that were NOT supposed to be editable.
It would make sense to take into account the EDIT screen for all Edit operations, including Bulk Edit too.
fields.summary: Bulk change (Edit Issues) should not be possible for fields that are not part of the EDIT screen.

h3. Notes

Works in Chrome and Firefox

/secure/Dashboard.jspa [c.a.g.renderer.internal.GadgetSpecFactoryImpl] Error occurred while retrieving gadget spec for rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin:activitystream-gadget/gadgets/activitystream-gadget.xml

{noformat}

As JRA-36670 and its many duplicates illustrate, JIRA users are wasting countless hours and nerve cells on typing comments that disappear when an escape button is accidentally pressed, while Atlassians are losing karma and wasting hours on explaining why they are not going to make the escape action warn users about losing two pages of carefully typed text.

There is no need for this suffering and waste!

Leave escape behavior as it is now -- quick and easy. Add a personal history of a few last canceled text edits. If I just wasted an hour on a disappeared comment, I would be very happy to go to some obscure page and copy-paste my lost comment from there.

Good UX. No UI complications at all. And no users that hate you for making their text disappear. Yes, adding a personal history of canceled comments requires work, but that is not an excuse to avoid fixing a serious UX problem, is it?

As a user and Admin, I would like to be able to get notifications when a user is given Administrative permission(added to jira-administrator group or given the global permission for that group).
The reason for this is it allows us monitor how many Admins there are on the system and in the case of a breach such as someone breaching the system and adding a user to the admin group, when we get notified, System Admin can know there has been a breach.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45442].
  {panel}

It would be useful to allow a custom field to be created which links to a confluence page.

This functionality does exist within the "linked issues" field, however my use case requires something a little different.

I would like to be able to have a workflow condition that a transition cannot be performed unless the field "Standard Operating Procedure Document Link" is filled out. Sure, I can throw the URL of the confluence page in there, but I'd like my application link to be able to search confluence for the relevant doc.

I'm sure I could perhaps also have a condition to check that there is a standard "Linked Issue" present but this field is likely to already be filled by links to IT & Infrastructure tickets.

For some context, this is an effort to improve IT/Infra documentation across our organisation. We have a JIRA Infrastructure Change Management project where risk assessments are written for IT/Infra changes which have various conditions and approval steps etc. We want it so that the last step is to create a Standard Operating Procedure document, without which, the JIRA task cannot be marked as resolved.

This could perhaps be done as an enhancement to the existing "Multi Issue Selector" custom field type, whereby there would be an additional context type of "Confluence Link".

Bob Swift would nail this in a flash, I'm sure.
fields.summary: Allow Multi Issue Selector Custom Field to link to Confluence pages.
